page.title: 09Farming - General
page.content: Local farms are mixed, of l00-300 acres and worked by the family with some extra labour at harvest, or with contractors. The preferred breeds seem to be Hereford-Freisan crosses and Suffolk sheep. Cattle are left out all year. One farm has pigs also and there is one intensive pig farm. Poultry are kept for family needs mostly. Crop and pasture ratios vary. Grass is grown more for hay than silage and crops are rotated to produce cereals,swedes, sugar beet and potatoes. E.E.C. regulations appear to have little effect but have restricted choices, e.g. milk quotas. Most farmers use the Marketing Boards for potatoes,wool and milk and transport stock,for up to l00 miles. Beet is transported to factories by a set date
